Description: Lower body sherd of early Chian pottery patterned chalice with part of handle zone and cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with bands in added white; exterior reserved save two brown bands flanking handle zone, in which there are. at far left, part of one vertical stroke and, central, double saw-edged metope pattern; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0315) (phase 2)
